```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE
                      , results = 'asis'
                      , warning = FALSE
                      , message = FALSE)
```

A single zip file will be available for download.  It will include all result
files along wiht the original data file.  All result data files will be CSV 
format.

The zip file will included the base name of the original file along with the 
date and time.

The individual files will include the same basename along with a suffix to 
represent each step of the calculation process.

As an example if the input file was "Data_BCG_PacNW.csv" the result files will
look like those in the table below.

```{r}
fn_base <- "Data_BCG_PacNW"
suffix <- c(paste0("_bcgcalc_"
            , c("1markexcl"
                , "2metval_all"
                , "2metval_BCG"
                , "3metmemb"
                , "4levmemb"
                , "5levassign"
                , "6levflags"
                , "RESULTS")))
file_names <- c(paste0(fn_base, ".csv")
       , paste0(fn_base, suffix, ".csv")
       , paste0(fn_base, "_RESULTS.html"))
file_desc <- c("User input data"
               , "Exclude taxa revised, if checked (BioMonTools::markExcluded)"
               , "Metric values, all (BioMonTools::metric.values)"
               , "Metric values, only those used in index and flags"
               , "Metric membership (BCGcalc::BCG.Metric.Membership)"
               , "Level membership (BCGcalc::BCG.Level.Membership)"
               , "Level assignment (BCGcalc::BCG.Level.Assignment)"
               , "BCG flags summary"
               , "Results, levels and flags"
               , "Results summary report") 
df_zip <- data.frame(cbind(file_names, file_desc))
names(df_zip) <- c("File Names", "File Descriptions")
cap_zip <- "BCG Calculation zip file contents."
knitr::kable(df_zip, caption = cap_zip)

```
